title: Protocol for scChaRM-seq: Simultaneous profiling of gene expression, DNA methylation, and chromatin accessibility in single cells
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
The scChaRM-seq could be applied to various types of mammalian cells (if a cell contains poly-A tailed mRNA, DNA methylation modification and chromosomes), including cell lines and tissue cells. In this protocol, we took use of mouse embryonic stem cells (ES cells or ESCs) as an example cell line to describe step-by-step method details.
Preparation single-cell suspension of mouse ESCs
Timing: 3 days
Routine culture of mouse ES cells follows the published protocol (Samuelson and Metzger, 2006[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib8]) under either 2i- or serum- containing media (Ficz et al., 2013[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib4]). Single-cell suspension is prepared during propagation after cell detachment by using trypsin. The viability of mouse ES cells should be above 95% (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]).

(A) Clone morphology of mouse ES cells.
(B) Examination of cell viability by trypan blue staining (CountessTM 3 FL Automated Cell Counter).
Single-cell lysis and in vitro GpC methylation
Timing: 1–2 h
Note: All the buffer and reaction mixtures should be prepared on ice.
Prepare lysis & in vitro methylation buffer (LM buffer) for individual cell.
Add 2.5 μL LM buffer to each 0.25-mL PCR tube and place the tube on ice.
Manually pick individual cell under the stereo-microscope with mouth-pipette, and transfer single cell into 0.25-mL PCR tube containing ice-cold LM buffer.
Note: One needs practice to perform step 3. For how to use mouth-pipette to manually selecting single cells, please refer to Lipovsek et al. (2020)[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib7] as a learning example (Lipovsek et al., 2020[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib7]).
Vortex briefly and centrifuge at 1,000× g for 1 min at 4°C, then immediately place the tube back on ice.
Incubate single cell sample in a thermal cycler at 37°C for 15 min.

After incubation, centrifuge at 7,500 × g for 1 min at 4°C and put the sample back on ice.
Add 5 μL of Buffer RLT Plus to each single cell sample.
Vortex briefly and incubate the mixture at 25°C for 5 min.
Quickly centrifugation (7,500 × g for 30 s) and proceed to the next step, or transfer samples to a −80°C freezer.
Pause point: The in vitro methylated cell samples can be stored at −80°C for several days.
Critical: Because PMSF is toxic, wear protective gloves, eye/face protection and protective clothing to avoid accidentally inhalation while handling.
Separation of mRNA from lysate
Timing: 0.5–1 h
For each barcoded oligo-dT-C1 beads: transfer 10 μL of oligo-dT-C1 beads to a 0.25-mL PCR tube, and place it on a magnetic rack for 1 min, and then remove and discard the supernatant.
Remove tube from magnetic rack, re-suspend the beads with 10 μL of re-suspend buffer and keep it on ice.
Add 10 μL of oligo-dT-C1 beads to the 7.5 μL of single cell lysate.
Vortex briefly and incubate for 10 min at 25°C.
Briefly spin down the sample on a benchtop mini centrifuge, place the tube on a magnetic rack for 1 min and transfer the supernatant to a new 0.25-mL PCR tube, keep it on ice.
Wash the beads on the magnetic rack once with 30 μL of DNA wash buffer for 5 min and transfer the supernatant to the same tube containing gDNA from a single cell.
Collect the released gDNA from a single cell (47.5 μL in total) on ice and keep it at −80°C until further processing.
Pause point: The gDNA can be stored at −80°C for several weeks.
Critical: The mRNA captured on the oligo-dT-C1 beads needs to be processed to the next step immediately.
Reverse transcription

Timing: 2 h
Prepare the reverse transcription reaction buffer (RT reaction buffer).
Add 5 μL of RT reaction buffer to the remaining beads containing mRNA from a single cell.
Vortex briefly and spin down quickly.
Incubate the reaction in a thermal cycler with a heated lid (105°C), as detailed below:

PCR preamplification
Timing: 3 h
Centrifuge the RT sample at 7,500 × g for 1 min.
Prepare the PCR preamplification mixture for a single cell.
Add 7.5 μL of PCR preamplification mixture to each single-cell sample. Vortex briefly and spin down quickly.
Perform the PCR in a thermal cycler (lid temp. 105°C) by using the following program:
table:files/protocols_protocol_1194_17.csv
Quantification the concentration of single-cell cDNA by the Qubit Fluorometer.
Note: The total number of PCR cycles depends on the RNA content in different type of cells. 18 cycles indicated in this protocol are suitable for mouse embryonic stem cells. The number of cycles can be increased for cells which have limited mRNA (e.g., cumulus cells, 20 cycles) or decreased for cells which have abundant mRNA (e.g., oocytes, 16 cycles).
Pause point: PCR products can be stored at −20°C for several weeks.
cDNA purification
Timing: 1–1.5 h
Pool 6 μL of the PCR products from each single-cell sample which are labeled by one of twenty-four different barcodes.
Purify once with Zymo DNA Clean & Concentrator-5 Kit according to the manufacturer’s protocol, elute in 50 μL elution buffer.
Quantification the concentration of single-cell cDNA by the Qubit Fluorometer.
Add 40 μL of equilibrated AMPure XP beads to each single-cell sample and mix by vortex to make the solution homogeneous.
Incubate the mixture for 10 min at 25°C to let the DNA bind to the beads.

Place the tube on the magnetic rack for 5 min until the solution is clear and the beads have been collected at one corner of the well.
Carefully remove and discard the liquid without disturbing the beads. Wash the beads twice with 200 μL 80% (vol/vol) ethanol solution.
Remove any trace of ethanol and let the beads dry completely (usually 3–5 min).
Before removing tube from the magnetic rack, add 30 μL elution buffer. Mix by vortex, incubate the tube off the magnetic rack for 2 min.
Place the tube on the magnetic rack and leave it until the solution appears clear and beads have accumulated in a corner of the well.
Collect the supernatant without disturbing the beads and transfer it to a fresh 1.5-mL DNA LoBind Tube.
Measure the concentration of cDNA by the Qubit Fluorometer.
Pause point: Single-cell cDNA can be stored at −20°C for several weeks.
Quality check of the cDNA
Timing: 1 h
Check the size distribution of the cDNA on a Fragment analyzer. A good cDNA sample should show a peak approximately at 1–2 kb, and the yield of the cDNA sample is approximately more than 50 ng.
Indexing PCR amplification
Timing: 1 h
Prepare the indexing PCR (Table 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl2]) mixture for pooled single-cell cDNA. Use ∼40 ng cDNA as template, add 29 μL of indexing PCR mixture to each single-cell sample to a total volume of 50 μL. Vortex briefly and spin down quickly.
Perform the PCR in a thermal cycler (lid temp. 105°C) by using the following program:

Add 40 μL of equilibrated AMPure XP beads to PCR products, purify once and elute with 30 μL elution buffer (For detailed steps of purifying DNA with AMPure XP beads, please refer to “cDNA purification[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec3.6]” above).

Quantification the cDNA concentration by the Qubit Fluorometer.
Pause point: PCR products can be stored at −20°C for several weeks.
cDNA library construction
Timing: 3 h
Following the manufacturer’s protocol, fragmentation of cDNA sample by the CovarisTM to achieve peak distribution around 300–350 bp. The default programs and settings are pre-installed by the manufacturer, and could be easily selected to use.
After sonication, purify once with Zymo DNA Clean & Concentrator-5 Kit according to the manufacturer’s protocol, elute in 50 μL elution buffer.
Purify once with 50 μL of equilibrated AMPure XP beads, elute in 50 μL nuclease-free water (For detailed steps of purifying DNA with AMPure XP beads, please refer to “cDNA purification[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec3.6]” above).
Take 10 μL of Dynabeads™ MyOne™ Streptavidin C1 beads into 1.5-mL tube, wash the beads once with 200 μL 2× B&W buffer on magnetic rack, re-suspend beads with 50 μL 2× B&W buffer by vortex.
Incubate 50 μL of eluted cDNA sample with re-suspended beads at 25°C for 30 min.
After incubation, put each tube on magnetic rack, then discard the supernatant.
Add 100 μL 1× B&W buffer to wash beads, then add 100 μL elution buffer to wash beads again. Re-suspend beads in 50 μL nuclease-free water and keep it on ice.
Following the manufacturer’s protocol of the NEBNext Ultra II DNA Library Prep Kit, then perform “End repair” and “Adapter ligation” steps.
After incubation with the USER enzyme for 15 min, spin down and put each tube on magnetic rack, discard the supernatant.
Add 100 μL elution buffer to wash beads, then discard the supernatant.
Re-suspend beads in 11 μL nuclease-free water.
PCR amplification
Timing: 2 h
Add 11 μL of adaptor ligated cDNA fragments to 14 μL of NEB final PCR mixture.
Perform PCR amplification (lid temp. 105°C) as follows:
table:files/protocols_protocol_1194_19.csv

Purify the PCR mix twice by equilibrated AMPure XP beads and elute in 30 μL of elution buffer (For detailed steps of purifying DNA with AMPure XP beads, please refer to “cDNA purification[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec3.6]” above).
Measure the concentration of RNA library by the Qubit Fluorometer.
Quality check of the final RNA library
Timing: 1 h
Check the size distribution of the final RNA library on a Fragment analyzer. A good RNA library is approximately more than 100 ng, and usually ranges from 200 bp to 800 bp.
Purification of genomic DNA
Timing: 1 h
Purify the gDNA with 47.5 μL of equilibrated AMPure XP beads (For detailed steps of purifying DNA with AMPure XP beads, please refer to “cDNA purification[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec3.6]” above). Elute gDNA with 10 μL of nuclease-free water, and transfer the gDNA to a new 0.25-mL PCR tube.
Bisulfite conversion of gDNA
Timing: 3.5 h
Use EZ-96 DNA Methylation-Direct MagPrep Kit following the manufacturer’s protocol to conduct CT conversion of gDNA from single cell. DNA was bisulfite converted as follows:
table:files/protocols_protocol_1194_20.csv
Add 10 ng of carrier RNA to each sample before purification and elute DNA with 10 μL of elution buffer.
Incubate at 55°C for 4 min and transfer 9.25 μL to a new 0.25-mL PCR tube.
DNA libraries construction by TAILS
Timing: 5 h
Incubate the 9.25 μL of bisulfite converted and purified gDNA at 65°C for 3 min; 4°C for pause to stretch the DNA strand.
Add 3.25 μL of 1st round priming mixture to each single-cell DNA sample.
Perform the first random priming as follows:

After incubation, transfer immediately to ice. Add 5 μL of dC tailing mixture to single-cell sample.
Incubate sing-cell sample as follows:

After incubation, transfer immediately to ice. Add 5 μL of 2nd round priming mixture to single-cell sample.
Synthesize the second DNA strands as follows:

After incubation, transfer immediately to ice.
Pause point: After the second-round priming, samples can be stored at −20°C for 1 day.
Purification and PCR amplification
Timing: 1.5–2 h
Purify the single-cell DNA samples once with equilibrated AMPure XP beads, elute with 12 μL of nuclease-free water and transfer 11 μL to a new 0.25-mL PCR tube (For detailed steps of purifying DNA with AMPure XP beads, please refer to “cDNA purification[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec3.6]” above).
Add 14 μL DNA final PCR mixture to the 11 μL of purified DNA sample, vortex and spin down briefly.
Perform the PCR amplification (lid temp. 105°C) as follows:

Pooling and gel recovery
Timing: 2–2.5 h
Pooling the PCR products together: 12.5 μL of each single-cell's DNA for 24 samples.
Purify with Zymo DNA Clean & Concentrator-5 Kit according to the manufacturer’s protocol, elute in 20 μL of nuclease-free water.
After 1.5% agarose electrophoresis, recover the DNA between 400-bp and 1,000-bp by using the Zymoclean Gel DNA Recovery Kit according to the manufacturer’s protocol.
Purify the DNA with equilibrated AMPure XP beads, elute with 20 μL of elution buffer (For detailed steps of purifying DNA with AMPure XP beads, please refer to “cDNA purification[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec3.6]” above).
Quality check of the final DNA library
Timing: 1 h
Quantify the libraries and check the size distribution with a Fragment Analyzer. The yield of the DNA library is approximately more than 30 ng, and the size distribution is between 400 bp and 1 kb.
